line.en: 'Ohhh...'
Amane was looking over the parts that I had\nbrought her from every angle. She let out sounds\nof admiration.
'Is this OK?'
'Yes... There's no doubt about it!'
Fwoosh!
'Whoaaah!!'
'Thank you...!!!!!'
She suddenly hugged me.
'Huh? Again?'
'Whoa, wh-what's going on?'
'Thank you, thank you!!'
Amane pushed her forehead onto mine and rubbed it\nround and round.
'Ack... O...ouch! Hey, that hurts, Amane!'
'I'm not good at expressing my thanks! That's\nbecause I'm stupid!'
Rub rub!
'(I...it hurts... but it feels good.)'
Because she is holding me tightly, and our\nforeheads are pressed pogether, her ample chest\npushes against me.
Not only is she beautiful, but she's stylish too.\nThey're bigger than they look, so I have no\nchoice but to experience this.
'How disgusting... Look at his face.'
'He's having dirty thoughts.'
'S-So are you! You're just making up whatever you\nfeel like!'
It's lunchtime, by the way.
I brought the parts that An-chan gave me to the\ngarage, but because the reaction was much more\nthan I expected, I'm in a state of confusion.
Kotori, who I came here with, and Ageha, who had\ncome along for some reason, are both staring at\nme with needles.
'Thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you!'
After tearing Amane away from me, who was kind of\nlike a big playful dog, I once again pass the\nparts to her.
'P-Please, go ahead and use them.'
'Thank you... But how on earth did you get\nthese?'
'A friend of mine works in a factory that deals\nwith the manufacture and processing of special\nparts.'
'For this kind of thing, he should usually be\nable to make it for me.'
It seems that for this, An-chan looked at the\nengineering diagram and made something that was\nthe same.
'Ha ha ha, let's put them on right now!'
Amane took the parts over to the glider.
'Whew... that was a surprise...'
'Amane's pretty bold, isn't she?'
'She hugged him the other day too, and he was\nloving it, that sleaze!'
'I guess that Aoi is just a typical guy, right?'
'Don't say things like that about me!'
'Anyway, why did you come with us?'
'Me? I wanted to talk to Amane.'
'Also, I thought it would be interesting!'
Kotori was being pretty snappy since just now.
She might be annoyed because someone else found\nout about our secret place.
Amane, like a kid given a birthday present, has\nimmediately started work on installing the parts.
It looks like the parts are used by the\ninstruments in the cockpit. She diligently\ndismantles the older parts.
'So this is a glider?'
Ageha, standing besides Amane, watches her work.
'This doesn't have an engine, does it? How does\nit fly?'
'It rides on the wind.'
'But first, it has to take off, right?'
'Yes, there are several methods for doing that.\nBut, in this case, a winch is used to fly it like\na kite.'
'Huh? Something this big?'
'Yeah.'
Ageha stares at the aircraft in disbelief.
Kotori and I look untirely at the sleep aircraft,\nas if appreciating a work of art.
Immersed in installing the parts, Ageha seems to\nhave completely forgotten that we're there.
It's like when I met Amane for the first time.
'It will fly again...!'
'It will fly to the sky that Isuka spoke of.'
'What's up?'
'Uh... no, nothing...'
'Excuse me.'
A female student, who looks like a senior, comes\ninto the garage.
'Is Mochizuki-senpai here?'

name: Girl who seems like a senior

line.en: 'I make a bewildered face, as if asking "Who's\nshe?", then Ageha tells me.
'That's the vice president of the student\ncouncil, Akari Kumoi.'
Vice president of the student council?
What on earth does she want?
'If you're looking for Amane...'
At that moment, she had her head in the cockpit.
As the vice president sees that, she briskly\napproaches the cockpit and peers inside.
'Mochizuki-senpai.'
'Mochizuki-senpai!'
She called out in a loud voice, and Amane finally\npulls her out of the cockpit.
'Hi, vice president.'

From her familiar tone towards Amane, I thought
that they might have had a close relationship.
But, the vice president doesn't seem that way at
all.
Without losing her resolute attitude, she asks\nher question.
'What have you done about the matter in\nquestion?'
'Umm... The truth is, I still haven't done it.'
'Are the people in here with you?'
'No, they're not. They just came to deliver some\nparts.'
Amane was downhearted as she answered. The vice\npresident let out a little sigh.
'I've told you before, if you can't find\nadditional members for the club, then the club\nwill have to be abolished.'
'Huh?'
'Why's that??'
Astonished, we look on as bystanders as the\nconversation continues.
'B-But, vice president...'
'The teachers recognize that this is a special\ncase, but it sets a bad example to the other\ncircles that have a low number of members.'
'If this isn't properly organized as a club, then\nit will inevitably have its status repealed!'
'Uunnh...'
Amane looked down as though she was at a complete\nloss.
For some reason, I get a strange pain inside as I\nlook at her.
'It's fine, isn't it?'
Kotori suddenly jumped into the conversation.
'Huh? You must be Kotori Habane.'
While slightly surprised that she knew who she\nwas, Kotori continued to speak.
'The teachers said it was OK, didn't they? In\nthat case, you shouldn't be complaining!'
'...And also, Amane is a special case herself,\nisn't she?'
'This is the reason why she repeats the year...\nEveryone knows that's why she's in this school.'
I thought I saw veins appear on the vice\npresident's temples as the two of them ranted at\nher.

'For the teachers to interfere in matters
pertaining to club activities, is a clear
infringement on the autonomy of the student
council.'
'That is exactly the case in this situation.'
She thrusts forward, approaching one step, while\nAgeha and Kotori, take one back.

'There are many circles that wish to be made into
clubs. They do not receive a club budget, and in
many cases, do not fulfill the club activity
requirements necessary to be given a clubhouse.'
'Yesterday, the Taiko Drum Study Society applied\nfor a place to practice, but had to be rejected.'
'When that happened, do you know what they said?'
'They... uh...'
'How would we know that?'
'The Soaring Club, which has one member, has a\nbig garage to use, so why isn't there a single\nplace we can practice?'
'Do you not think that their opinion is an\nextremely fair one?'
'...It is.'
'Even so, the ones who had their application\nrejected, obviously won't be able to consent to\nthat, will they?'
'However, the fact that this garage has been used\nby the Soaring Club since before we were even\nborn cannot be ignored.'
'That's because the teachers recognize this as a\nspecial case, or perhaps there is some other\nreason.'
'We in the student council respect that fact.'
'That is why...'
The vice president turns from facing Kotori and\nAgeha, and looks back round at Amane, who is\nnervously listening behind her.
'...it is up to you to take immediate action, as\nwe have requested.'
'If you need to see the fruits of the club's\nactivities, a few days ago, I performed a test\nflight...'
'Didn't that take place during lesson time!?'
'That's outrageous! On the contrary, you should\nconsider that another reason to abolish the\nclub!'
'Waaaah!!!!'
Amane staggered back as if she had been hit hard.
'(I guess that's true, though, isn't it...?)'
Lessons were taking place in school, when Kotori\nand I watched the glider flying across the sky,\non Windmill Hill.
'Do you understand? A minimum of four members are\nrequired in order to be recognized as a club! You\nmust find another three members for the club.'
Amane looked down with a very grave expression.
'But this is all done for myself...'
'In that case, it cannot be recognized as a\nclub.'
'I'll join.'
'Huh?'
I raise my hand and the others all look at me.
'You are the boy who transferred here recently,\naren't you...? You must be Aoi Minase.'
The vice president looks at me as if she is\nevaluating me.
'I'll tell you this now, we will not allow there\nto be 'ghost members'!'
'I know.'
'That's why I came today.'
I had decided this morning, well, yesterday,\nactually.
I still don't know much about gliders though.
I just thought it would be interesting.
By just imagining flying it riding on the wind, I\nget excited.
'If Amane-senpai will allow me to, that is.'
'Y-Yeah, if you want to join, I don't mind.'
'...But I'm only doing this for myself, you\nknow?'
'I still don't know much about gliders, or about\nyou either, Amane.'
'But if that's what you want to do, then I'd like\nto help you.'
As I state my reasons, the vice president looks\nas though she isn't convinced.
It looks like some transfer student, who doesn't\neven understand the situation, has come barging\nin, trying to act like a hero.
I can't say that there isn't some element of that\nto it.
'Well then, I'll join too!'
Ageha raised her hand in a really casual manner.
'Huh?'
Even with everyone looking at her, Ageha appears\naloof.
'Is it OK that I'm also a member of the Robotics\nClub?'
'Yeah, that's fine, but...'
'What're you doing, Ageha?'
'What? It looks like fun!'
One person left.
Everyone naturally looks over towards Kotori.
Kotori turned her wheelchair sideways to avoid\neveryone's line of sight.
'...I'm not joining.'
As Kotori says this, the vice president made a\nface that seemed relieved, yet disappointed.
'You still need one more person. There's no way\nit can be recognized as a club as things stand\nnow.'
'If it's decided that it can't be allowed, what\nwill happen?'
'First, you will have to vacate this garage.'
'Hnnnn...'
Amane looks really distressed.
Well, of course she does.
If there's nowhere to keep this giant glider,\nthen club activities cannot continue.
'There's only myself and Ageha right now, so\nwe'll get one more. Could you wait until then?'
'Very well. I will wait until Friday.'

'If you can't get more members by then, then it
will be reduced to the position of a circle. You
no longer be able to use the garage. Is that
understood?'
Lacking confidence, Amane nods in agreement. The\nvice president leaves the garage.
'Kotori, you're not in any clubs, are you?'
'Can we just give your name? Just until we find\nsomeone else.'
'...I refuse.'
Kotori bluntly refused and left the garage.
'So it's no use...'
'We have to do something about it ourselves.'
'Say, you guys...'
'We're sorry, Amane, that we caused things to\nturn out like this.'
'No, you helped me out. If it weren't for you,\nthe club would've had its status taken away.'
'...But, is it really alright with you?'
'That's what I plan to do from now on.'
'Me too. I'm interested in this in so many ways!'
'Leave gathering members to us.'
'Amane, as for the club's activities, please put\nsomething together that will make the vice\npresident understand.'
'Umm... Yes, I will.'
'Is this alright with you?'
'What is?'
'Today is the first time you've been in the\ngarage, right? Even so, you've suddenly become a\nmember.'
'Hmmm... But it sure does look like fun!'
'You're here too, Aoi!'
'What am I gonna do with you?'
'That thing flies, right?' You can't possibly\ntell me not to be excited!'
'Yeah, I know what you mean!'
Without thinking I raised my voice.
I was happy that Ageha felt the same way.
'Well, in my case, I'm more interested in making\nit fly than getting in and flying it myself.'
'I want to try to fly it. And also...'
'She has stayed in school all this time,\nrepeating the year over and over, to do this, you\nknow?'
'So they say.'
'Amane doesn't go to lessons, and always just\nstays in the garage.'
'...I don't know if that's the truth or not, but\nwhat I do know is that she is taking this very\nseriously.'
I can't let it all end for some stupid reason,\nlike there not being enough members.
'First, we have to find a member for the club.'
'Let's try asking him.'
'A glider? What's that? Sounds kinda\ninteresting.'
'Doesn't it? So, do you wanna join the club?'
'Well... I have my part-time job. Also, if I get\ntoo friendly with you, then Eri-chan will get\njealous. So, I'll have to pass.'
'You'll figure something out. It's fine, she'll\nnever know!'
'Yes she will! Eri-chan has friends in this\nschool.'
'So, you really shouldn't speak to me.'
'Grrr... You've been like this ever since you got\na girlfriend. We're childhood friends, aren't we?\nWhat happened to our friendship?'
'I'm busy with the band, so there's no way. We're\nplaying a gig soon! So now, we're rehearsing.'
'Tsk! You're so coldhearted!'
'Why don't you ask him? Aoi, I mean.'
'I can't ask him, he's already a member.'
'What? So you guys are hanging out again?'
'What? Is there something wrong with that? We\nwant you to come with us too, you know!'
'Who'd wanna hang out with him!? Ptoo! Ptoo!'
'Eww, gross! Don't spit!'
'Dammit, Ma-bou, you're such a pain in the butt!'
'Hey, Ageha.'
'Yeah?'
'I dunno. ...This time, give it your best shot.'
'Huh? What're you talking about?'
'Geez, just get outta here will ya? Go on, shoo,\nshoo!'
'You idiot, Ma-bou.'
'It was no use.'
'So, was it my fault after all?'
'No. He's busy with his girlfriend, his part-time\njob and his band. He's really making the most of\nbeing a teenager.'
'In the past, we used to hang out all the time.'
'What are you talking about? If Ma-bou treated us\nlike we were more important to him than his\ngirlfriend, what do you think would happen?'
'I'm gonna give him the Cobra Twist. Until he\ncries.'
'So, there's nothing we can do about it?'
'Next is... Oh, that's right, Hotaru comes here,\ndoesn't she?'
We went to the first-year classroom.
When students from the upper grades come to\nvisit, there's a strange air of tension in the\nclassroom.
'What's up, Ageha, Aoi?'
'Wh-What is it?'
'Well, this is the first time I've seen you in\nyour uniform, it suits you.'
When I met her yesterday, she was wearing her own\nclothes.
'You kind of look more grown up.'
I only said it to tease her, but she went red,\nlike she was on fire or something, and got really\nflustered.
'Oh, don't say that, Aoi... I don't look grown\nup... ah...'
'Hey, Aoi. Don't tease the juniors.'
'I'm kind of teasing her. But, I do mean what I\nsay.'
'That's even worse.'
'A-Agetha... looks cuter, doesn't she?'
'Huh? Me?'
'Yeah. See, Aoi. The uniform suits her better\nthan me.'
'Oh, hardly! Ma-bou said that I'm a boy on the\ninside!'
'But her appearance has gotten much cuter, don't\nyou think?'
When Hotaru looks at me with those innocent,\nsparkling eyes, I cannot tell a lie.
'Well, yeah, I do think she's gotten cuter.'
BAM!
'Aaaargh!!'
I eat an elbow to the ribs. Ouch.
'...Th-Thanks, I think you've gotten a lot cooler\ntoo, Aoi.'
She said the same thing again. This time, in the\nfirst-year classroom. So, of course I feel\nembarrassed.
The reason why I'm looking down is because my\nribs hurt though.
'Anyway, that's not what we came here to talk\nabout!'
Ageha, continuing with the momentum from before,\ntalks to Hotaru about how we are looking for\nmembers for the Soaring Club.
'Ageha, you and Aoi are in the same club?'
'Yes, we are. That's why I wondered if you might\nlike to join too.'
'Well...'
Glare...
Hotaru glances at me.
'...No, I'd rather not.'
'Why not?'
'I have to help out at home.'
'Yes, but you only need to help out on Sundays.'
'But, from now on...'
She seems kind of wavering, yet firm in her\nreply.
Maybe there's a reason for it.
'OK, we get it, Hotaru. But if you're interested,\ncome any time.'
'OK.'
'It's finished.'
Kotori brings over the cucumber that she had\ncrushed into about the right size, using a wooden\npestle.
'Is it really OK to do it like this?'
'Yeah, that way, it absorbs the flavor a lot\nbetter.'
We're going to marinade the cucumber. It absorbs\nthe flavor a lot more easily if it is crushed\nthan if it is chopped with a knife.
'Is there anything else left to do?'
'Hmmm... I think that's it.'
'Right. I'm off.'
'...What?'
'We still can't find anyone who wants to join the\nclub. We tried all the people we could think of.'
'...I see.'
'You seem even more interested in it than we are,\ndon't you?'
The time on Windmill Hill, when first we saw the\nglider flying.
The time she wandered into the garage, and saw\nthe real thing up close.
The time we made the paper airplanes and flew\nthem together.
Her eyes were always shining, like a child's.
I can't forget the expression on Kotori's face.
She's usually so sulky, or looking as though\nshe's bored. But maybe, that's what her true\nexpression really is, I thought to myself.
'...If I joined the club, I'd just cause\nproblems.'
'What do you mean? No you wouldn't.'
To be perfectly honest, it would be great if she\nwould just join the club.
'But, I'll soon be...'
She stops mid-sentence and moves her wheelchair\nalong.
'Hey, can I ask you a question...?'
'No.'
'Why do want to drop out?'
'I said don't ask me!'
Kotori looks as though she's realized something.
'It was you after all! You picked up my\nwithdrawal notice!'
'Withdrawal notice? What's that? Does it taste\ngood? Can we have it with tonight's dinner?'
I play dumb, without hesitation.
'Uuuuh...'
'You idiot! You moron! You big meanie!'
'I hope you get stuck in a ditch and die!'
With a barrage of parting shots, Kotori hurried\naway.
